data.title: 以 1 到 3 分钟谈论以下主题
data.content: Name a time when you wanted something but could not have it. How did you feel about not getting it? What did you learn from this experience, and how will it help you in life?
data.answer: When it comes to something I wanted but could not have, I would say by instinct that it was a car. Last year, I felt like I needed a car to travel readily whenever I please. I couldn't help but imagine that once I got a car, I could drive to and from university for classes, join my friends' road trip during holidays and so forth. I then asked my parents. Unfortunately, they did not share the same opinion as I had and wouldn't lend me money. At the very moment I was rejected, I was overwhelmed by sadness as all my beautiful imagination collapsed. Undoubtedly, the incident did expose me to the importance of earning money by myself. I leant that as an adult, I must make my own living, and to achieve that, I must first study hard and find a rewarding job. (145字)
